description.narrative: Funding under this investment provides humanitarian assistance in response to the crisis in Iraq. The humanitarian situation in Iraq is rapidly deteriorating as people continue fleeing attacks by Daesh and other armed groups. Since the start of 2014, 3.3 million people have been displaced, and 10 million are now in need of humanitarian assistance. Funding is being provided to the World Food Programme (WFP) for urgent food assistance and other international humanitarian partners for household items, access to water and healthcare. Funding is also being provided to UNDP in support of stabilisation in newly liberated areas. The total value of this investment is $20 million, starting 2015-16.
